title: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The issue is related to the usage of Class.forName() in the BidiUtil class in the win32 version of the software. Specifically, the line 'static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, 'windowProc', 4);' is causing a NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT.
EB: The line of code mentioned in the description should be changed to 'static Callback callback = new Callback (new BidiUtil().getClass(), 'windowProc', 4);' This change is expected to resolve the issue without affecting the functionality.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, perform the following steps:
1. Use the CLDC version of SWT.
2. Verify or use jxeLink or another similar tool.
3. Compile the code involving the BidiUtil class.
4. Observe the NoClassDefFoundError caused by the Class.forName() usage in the BidiUtil class.
